sorcer.core.provider
Class ServiceProvider

java.lang.Object
  sorcer.core.provider.ServiceProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
DestroyAdmin, LifeCycle, Remote, EventListener, Administrable, JoinAdmin, RemoteMethodControl, ProxyAccessor, ReferentUuid, ServiceIDListener, ServerProxyTrust, AdministratableProvider, ContextManagement, RemoteContextManagement, Monitorable, Provider, Outer, Partner, Partnership, SorcerConstants, Identifiable, Service
Direct Known Subclasses:
DatabaseProvider, DataSpaceProvider, ExertMonitor, RemoteLoggerManager, ServiceCataloger, ServiceJobber, ServiceSpacer, ServiceTasker
public class ServiceProvider
extends Object
implements Identifiable, Provider, ServiceIDListener, ReferentUuid, AdministratableProvider, ProxyAccessor, ServerProxyTrust, RemoteMethodControl, LifeCycle, Partner, Partnership, RemoteContextManagement, SorcerConstants

The ServiceProvider class is a type of Provider with dependency injection defined by a Jini 2 configuration, proxy management, and own service discovery management for registering its proxies. In the simplest case, the provider exports and registers its own (outer) proxy with the primary method Service.service(Exertion, Transaction). The functionality of an outer proxy can be extended by its inner server functionality with its Remote inner proxy. In this case, the outer proxies have to implement Outer interface and each outer proxy is registered with the inner proxy allocated with Outer.getInner() invoked on the outer proxy. Obviously an outer proxy can implement own interfaces with the help of its embedded inner proxy that in turn can consit of multiple own inner proxies as needed. This class implements the Outer interface, so can extend its functionality by inner proxying.

A smart proxy can be defined in the provider's Jini configuration by the smartProxy entry. This proxy does not represent directly any exported server, it is registered with lookup services as is. However, the smart proxy (implementing Outer interface) can extend its functionality by setting the providers outer proxy as its inner proxy. Thus, smart proxies that implementOuter, called semismart contain this provider's proxy as its inner proxy. Smart proxies that do not extend its functionality via its inner proxy are called fat proxies. Fat proxies do not make remote calls back to their providers and the providers just maintain lookup service registrations.

An inner or outer proxy can be a surrogate of a service partner defined by this provider using server configuration entry or two realted entries: serverType and serverName. If the entry server is defined and its exporter is defined by the entry serverExporter then this provider will use the server's proxy as the outer (primary proxy) and itself as the inner proxy. However if the exporter is not defined then the provider's proxy is primary (outer) and the server's proxy is the inner one.

On the other hand, if the server entry is not defined but at least serverType is defined then the instance of server is created and exported if the entry serverExporter is given. The exported server proxy becomes the primary provider's proxy. However, if no exporter is defined then server proxy becomes the inner proxy of this provider's proxy (outer proxy). Thus, exported servers use outer proxies while not exported user inner proxies of this provider. In this context, a smart proxy implementing Outer interface can get the outer proxy and its inner proxy composed in either direction provider/server proxy relationship.

A service method is a method returning ServiceContext and having a single parameter as ServiceContext. Service beans are components that implement interfaces in terms of service methods only. A list of service beans can be specified in a provider's Jini configuration as the beans entry. In this case a proxy implementing all interfaces implemented by service beans are dynamically created and registered with lookup services. Multiple SORECER servers can be deployed within a single ServiceProvider as its own service beans.

See Also:
Provider, ServiceIDListener, ReferentUuid, AdministratableProvider, ProxyAccessor, ServerProxyTrust, RemoteMethodControl, LifeCycle, Partner, Partnership, RemoteContextManagement, SorcerConstants

setAdmin

public void setAdmin(Object proxy)
Description copied from interface: Partnership
Returns the inner proxy of this provider. Inner proxies can be provided by the registering provider of this proxy or by third party providers. This proxy extends its local functionality by invoking remote methods on its inner proxy.

Specified by:
setAdmin in interface Partnership

addLookupAttributes

public void addLookupAttributes(Entry[] attrSets)
Add attribute sets for the service. The resulting set will be used for all future joins. The attribute sets are also added to all currently-joined lookup services.

Specified by:

Modify the current attribute sets, using the same semantics as ServiceRegistration.modifyAttributes. The resulting set will be used for all future joins. The same modifications are also made to all currently-joined lookup services.

Specified by:

Parameters:
attrSetTemplates - - the templates for matching attribute sets
attrSets - the modifications to make to matching sets

getProxy

public Object getProxy()
Returns a proxy object for this provider. If the smart proxy is alocated then returns a non exported object to be registerd with loookup services. However, if a smart proxy implements Outer then the provider's proxy is set as its inner proxy. Otherwise the Remote outer proxy of this provider is returned.

Specified by:
getProxy in interface ProxyAccessor
Specified by:
getProxy in interface Provider
Returns:
a proxy, or null
See Also:
Provider.getProxy()

getInner

public Remote getInner()
Description copied from interface: AdministratableProvider
Returns an inner proxy of the provider implementing this interface. The inner proxy can be provided by the registering provider. This proxy allows smart proxies to invoke remote methods on anoter types of proxies, e.g., its admin proxy, or to request a new inner proxy to replace the failing remote one.

Specified by:
getInner in interface AdministratableProvider
Specified by:
getInner in interface Outer
Returns:
an inner proxy of this proxy

setInner

public void setInner(Object innerProxy)
              throws ProviderException
Description copied from interface: Partnership
Sets an inner Remote proxy for this proxy. The inner proxy usually is exported by the service provider setting the inner proxy. The outer proxy can invoke methods on its inner proxy to extend its functionality accordingly.

This function may be called multiple times for each inner proxy. In this case, the implementor should check the instance type of inner.

Specified by:
setInner in interface Partnership
Parameters:
innerProxy - an inner proxy object
Throws:
ProviderException
